attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a company to keep quiet about a security breach.
attributes.background: If a company does not immediately inform customers of a data breach concerning their account details, that company is aiding and abetting criminal activity (the stealing of customers money and identities).
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have a right to be told immediately if their details have been compromised, and where the company has been negligent customers have a right to be compensated. 

Introduce a law making it a criminal offence for a company to not immediately inform customers of any breach of security that may have compromised customers' personal information (identity) or payment card details.

attributes.action: Unite all 43 police forces in England and Wales into one National Police Force.
attributes.background: A lot of money can be saved by the ilmination of duplication and as far as the British public is concerned, apart from the accent the North Yorkshire force is the same as the Met.

attributes.action: NHS, Fire, and Police, pay no income tax if earning below the national average.
attributes.background: My partner is a newly qualified neonatal nurse caring for seriously ill babies and as an example earns less than our postman for the same hours.
attributes.additional_details: Paying income tax means that part of their salary goes back to the NHS that employs them.

attributes.action: Give new and expectant mothers 6 months to pursue discrimination claims.
attributes.background: Mothers are being let down.The Equality and Human Rights Commission reported that 77% of women had experienced discrimination in the workplace due to pregnancy or maternity. However, a restrictive time-limit of 3 months is one of the reasons less than 1% of these are pursued to Tribunal. #GiveMeSix
attributes.additional_details:
Pregnancy and maternity discrimination is subtle by nature. For new and expectant mothers, dealing with this can be overwhelming. Many women wonâ€™t have the strength to tackle the issue immediately. Attempting to deal with this could put the health of the mother and unborn child at risk.

A 6 month time-limit would give mothers that little bit of breathing space. Help us reach 100,000 signatures so the 54,000 women a year who lose their jobs for being pregnant have greater access to justice.

attributes.action: Make Queen's birthday a national holiday
attributes.background: Make the Queen's birthday (the 21st of April) a UK wide public holiday.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the relationship between the UK and the EU after the exit.
attributes.background: Give the citizens of the United Kingdom the opportunity to decide if they want to maintain the access to the European Single Market without being a member of the European Union, either through a membership of the European Economic Area or through bilateral treaties (Swiss paradigm).

attributes.action: Temporary ban on United States citizens entering UK
attributes.background: In support and recognition of the US President's ban on countries deemed a "national security risk", we request the government issue a temporary ban on immigration and refugees from the dangerous state of the USA. Statistics show that additional security is required when admitting from this country.
attributes.additional_details:
Murder rate of USA is 3.9 compared with UK 0.9.

Gun death rate of USA is 10.54 compared with UK 0.23.

In 2015, American Dylann Roof killed 9 people in a terrorist attack.

In 1995, American Timothy McVeigh killed 169 people in a terrorist attack.

Between 1978 and 1995, American Ted Kaczynski carried out 16 terrorist bombings, killing 3.

In 2015, American Rizwan Farook killed 14 people in a terrorist attack.

attributes.action: Put the Investigatory Powers Bill to a referendum.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill is a piece of legislation that seriously infringes our right to a private life. The bill has been scarcely covered in the media and I believe that the British people should be given the opportunity to decide for themselves whether we are willing to give up our freedoms.
attributes.additional_details:
I urge everyone who reads this to do some extra research on the Investigatory Powers Bill, and other similar mass surveillance programs around the world, such as the NSA's Prism program. Please look up interviews from Edward Snowden and decide for yourself whether he is a traitor or a hero.

If the people decide that these programs and losing our rights are a worthy sacrifice for protection from terrorism then so be it, however, as it stands we have not been given a choice.

attributes.action: Offer more funds to councils to fix the roads
attributes.background: I have had 3 tyre punctures on my car due to the road surface being really bad.
attributes.additional_details: The roads in Oxford are pretty bad, council is not fixing them due to lack of funds.

attributes.action: Stop intelligence sharing with the USA and recall the UK Ambassador to the USA.
attributes.background: Suspend intelligence sharing with the USA to ensure that President Trump's new policy of religious discrimination is in no way assisted by the UK.The UK should also condem these actions by recalling the ambassador.
attributes.additional_details:
If we should learn anything from the Holocaust it is that descrimination based on religious beliefs is wrong and dangerous. 

"First they came for the Socialists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Socialist. 
Then they came for the Trade Unionists, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Trade Unionist.
Then they came for the Jews, and I did not speak out- because I was not a Jew.
Then they came for me- and there was no one left to speak for me." Martin NiemÃ¶ller

attributes.action: Remove the ban on owning Dogo argentinos,
attributes.background: Since 1991 this breed has been banned in the UK under the dangerous dogs act 1991, I propose that this law to either be heavily changed or removed, as people are becoming more aware that with this specific species the dogs themselves are not the problem, but the people that misuse and abuse them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogo argentinos are used as family dogs and guard dogs In their native country, just like GSD's, dobermann's and Rottweilers, they are renowned for their loyalty, and maternal instincts, to ban on dog because it looks menacing is wrong, as it promotes people to keep them for all the wrong reasons, just like every other dog consistent training and socialisation makes them perfect pets and companions, they are smart and are a reward to own because of their close loving bond with their owners.

attributes.action: I want the Jobcentre on Eastern Avenue in Sheffield to be saved
attributes.background:
The S2 area of Sheffield is full of vulnerable people, the support that is provided from the staff in this building is very positive.
Ive attended other jobcentres in the past but they have no connection with the area or the people in it. Eastern Avenue helps you feel like your not just a statistic
attributes.additional_details: Also why is it that in Sheffield only people from our area are going to be affected? People on benefits are in financial difficulty already and can easily walk to their local jobcentre to attend appointments and now only we are going to have to travel by public transport at additional costs to ourselves. I believed that we all had equal rights in this country and all should be treated the same so why only close the one office. Once again the government in this country treat us like a statistic.

attributes.action: Any public promise made by any holder of public office to be legally binding.
attributes.background: Holders of public office frequently promise to act on behalf of those who, ultimately employ them.  They also frequently break those promises, usually with impunity.  This lessens public trust and engagement, particularly in the field of politics.
attributes.additional_details: When a public figure makes a promise they are, essentially, making a contract with those people who employ them, elect them, or pay their salaries.  In response to these promises, we elect them, or allow them to retain their position - it is only fair and right that they should be required to stick to their promises, and yet, time and again, they do not.  There is not, at the moment, any realistic sanction available to us to prevent this, so I am proposing that there should be.

attributes.action: Make voting in general elections, and in future referendums compulsory.
attributes.background: Given the historical sacrifices made over any number of years by countless groups and individuals to enfranchise the public, the public should be required to vote, even if the choice is "none of the above". The lack of voting is a distinct failing or our democracy.

attributes.action: Bring back 30mph NATIONAL SPEED LIMIT (20mph is not practical on main roads)
attributes.background: Since setting of speed limits was relaxed, local councils have set inappropriate limits on main roads (sometimes across entire boroughs) without proper consultation (typically 20% or less of residents) and not used "LOCAL KNOWLEDGE" as suggested in Gov guidance. 20 is NOT PLENTY (in most cases)
attributes.additional_details:
With a 30 mph national limit, motorists knew where they stood legally

Southwark council consulted less than 400 people in their scheme to make the entire borough a 20mph zone (over 200,000 voters live in Southwark.

Islington cannot provide data to show the 20 mph borough has improved safety or reduced accidents

Most councils will use these artificially low limits as a revenue raiser, Traffic speed is slow enough in London without a 24hour 20mph limit being imposed unnecessarily.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all major UK roads and round-a-bouts to have CCTV
attributes.background: I am A university student at MMU. After experiencing a car crash on the underpass of Mancunion way on a major round-a-bout with both my flatmate and her friend. The police as helpful as they were, had no CCTV to catch the culprit.
attributes.additional_details:
The police, although busy, were wonderful in regards to the situation. After a Nissan Juke hitting a little car into a lamppost, the car was a write off. The man drove off, before we were even out of the car and the police, afterwards, informed us that there were no CCTV on the round-a-bout or on any of the roads in the direction he went.

I'm aware of multiple others having similar experiences, and feel that it would be both beneficial to the victims and the police to have CCTV on major roads.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hare coursing
attributes.background: We should lift the ban on hare coursing as it is a great tradition and if we do defend and fight for them such as fox hunting then there will be none of this country's traditions left !!
attributes.additional_details: Once the dog gets hold of the hare it is dead unlike shooting wear you could injure the hare or unsuccessfully kill it straight away

attributes.action: Make Mr Jeremy Hunt work in a busy hospital for a week so he can see for himself
attributes.background: It seems Mr Jeremy Hunt has an inaccurate view of the NHS and the pressure on it. Before he runs into the ground one of the greatest achievements in world history that is a big part of being British, he should work 12 hour shifts for a week to see how the system needs help.

attributes.action: Stop High street shops keeping their doors open regardless of the weather.
attributes.background:
Make retail outlets keep their doors routinely closed when premises are heated to reduce the energy (heat) which is currently wasted.
This will reduce the impact on the environment and global warming by reducing as well as significantly reducing operating costs for retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
You would not leave your door open in all weathers at home.
 Legislation exists to improve energy efficiency in new buildings but High street retailers routinely keep external doors open simply as a marketing tool. Automatic door openers offer some benefit but these are often disabled simply to encourage shoppers to enter and buy. Legislation applying to all retailers will provide a level playing field and reduce any perceived marketing benefit which drives the current bad practice.

attributes.action: Prime Ministers should explain why they have not implemented their manifesto
attributes.background: Governments regularly never implement manifesto pledges. Create a law that forces The Prime Minister before a General Election to explain to Parliament why pledges have not been implemented as described.
attributes.additional_details: Trust in politicians is at an all time low, people do not believe what they say. This simple law will encourage political parties to create a manifesto that they can realistically implement. I'm tired of politicians broken promises.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or sell animals within 1 month before Christmas
attributes.background: Many animals are sent to shelters as unwanted xmas presents right after xmas
attributes.additional_details: Leeds Dogs trust has received 500 calls re rehoming since xmas and this is just one city and this is repeated all over the country

attributes.action: Ban deer hunting
attributes.background: Hunting is cruel and unnecessary it causes pain and suffering many deer endure prolonged and painful death when they are injured but not killed by hunters This violent form of "entertainment" leaves countless orphaned or badly injured when hunters miss their target quick kills are rare
attributes.additional_details: A British study of deer hunting found that 11 percent of deer killed by hunters die only after being shot two or more times and that some wounded deer suffer for more than 15 minutes before dying

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the West Midlands Ambulance base at Aston Fire Station!
attributes.background: The West Midlands Ambulance Services central base is at the Aston Fire Station. Due to the Council saying they are no longer able to fund this they are planning to close the base unless they can raise Â£50,000! This would make Northfield and Erdington the next closest ambulance bases.
attributes.additional_details:
Anybody who has needed an Ambulance in an emergency for themselves or loved ones will know that minutes really matter, in a situation that requires immediate treatment those minutes really are the difference between life and death. The extra few miles these crews would have to travel will be costing vital seconds, even those of you outside Birmingham know the importance of the emergency services and their ability to respond quickly. Please sign and share, Thankyou
http://www.wmas.nhs.uk/about-us

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid Â£810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: charge UKentrants Â£10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of Â£10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Dont allow food companies to add air to food packages to make them look bigger.
attributes.background: Food manufacturers are filling food packages with air. This is wrong as we are being tricked to buying food and finding out that in food packaging a small percentage is actual food and a large percentage is filled with air! Food with packaging should have a limit to the amount of air it has.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence that manufacturers are filling food packages with air-

http://www.msn.com/en-gb/foodanddrink/foodnews/shocking-x-ray-images-reveal-how-food-manufacturers-are-cheating-shoppers-by-filling-packages-with-air/ar-AAltXRN?li=AAcVLvg&ocid=spartandhp

attributes.action: Withdraw all UK Government funding from PSNI.
attributes.background: Since the 'Good Friday' agreement there has been a total lack of commitment to investigate even-handedly the incidents which occurred during the conflict.  Some terrorists have actually received 'get out of jail' cards - yet the HIT are now concentrating on ex-members of HM Forces.

attributes.action: invest HS2 funding into social care.
attributes.background: Social care in England is grossly underfunded, to the point of collapse, HS2 is a vanity development which should be shelved until austerity measures have passed or be completely privately funded.

attributes.action: The UK should follow Sweden, cut VAT for fixing goods rather than throwing away.
attributes.background: To combat its â€˜throwaway consumer cultureâ€™, Sweden has announced tax breaks on repairs to clothes, bicycles, fridges and washing machines. Repairs are more labour-intense than production, which is largely automised, repairs actually contribute to an expanding labour market decreasing unemployment.
attributes.additional_details:
Jobs would be in the U.K. not abroad, they would be where you live & benefit the local economy.  Whereas large-scale manufacturing is very centralised. This will expand the number of companies giving these kinds of services so Itâ€™ll be easier for consumers to have things repaired.

It will be easier for people to buy high-quality products because they know itâ€™s affordable to have them fixed if something breaks, giving an  incentive not to buy as cheap as possible and then scrap something.

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: The government to legislate that all Local Authorities Provide Public Toilets.
attributes.background: To many Local Authorities are closing Public Toilets,to try and save money caused by the governments cut backs. The people of the UK deserve to have the essential use of public toilets. Local Authorities need to be accountable for this Public Service.

attributes.action: Require companies to give paid & undisclosed leave for Dysmenorrhea(period pain)
attributes.background: The higher the amount 'ill' days an employee or a prospective employee has can negatively affect employment. Symptoms are directly related to being a women. Some would say women need to be able to take days off every month without any record of them not working that day and to be paid in full.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/mar/02/uk-company-introduce-period-policy-female-staff
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38207846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37438767
http://zodiakmalawi.com/component/k2/why-every-woman-should-be-offered-menstrual-leave
http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/Periods-painful/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Forbid the use of CCTV by local councils for parking enforcement purposes
attributes.background: I am writing this as my local council is using a CCTV camera on a regular basis for the purpose of parking enforcement. The guidelines state this method should be used only "where other means of enforcement are not practical" - but nothing is more practical that a cheap and covert CCTV camera.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from section 1.13 of Surveillance Camera Code of Practice, June 2013, Home office:

"Motorists may regard enforcement by cameras as over-zealous and relevant authorities should use them sparingly. Such systems should , therefore, only be deployed where other means of enforcement are not practical and their effectiveness in achieving this purpose is subject to regular review."

attributes.action: Introduce Â£50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Make the carrying and use of self defence weapons legal for woman in the U.K.
attributes.background: In the UK it's illegal to own, carry or use self defence weapons such as CS gas or pepper spray.  Statistics for violent and sexual crimes are on the rise with more woman being attacked each day. A system needs to be put in place where woman can legally own, carry and use self defence weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
http://www.bsdgb.co.uk/index.php?Information:Law_Relating_to_Self_Defence

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for state schools by 2020.
attributes.background: With the recent increase of funding for grammar schools (Â£200 million), it is only fair that state schools are also funded since it will affect approximately 93% of the British school children which is 11.7 million. Â£54 billion is spent on state schools which is around 10.8% of total spending
attributes.additional_details: Please think of your children and or future children.

attributes.action: Introduce a flat rate of income tax of 15% and increase the threshold to Â£15,000
attributes.background: Exclude single incomes of less than Â£15,000 from income tax and National Insurance as these people cannot afford to be taxed. In addition, introduce a flat rate of income tax of 15% to ensure middle and high earners get to keep more of their hard earned money.
attributes.additional_details: The current levels of income tax are too high at 20% and 40%, dependent on income. A staggered tax system acts as a disincentive to earn more. If people had more money through reduced taxation, standard of living would increase and VAT to the government would increase as people invest in more luxuries. Welfare cuts as well as significant cuts in foreign aid spending could potentially cover the reduction in tax revenue.

attributes.action: parliament make a law. No levy on diesel cars before park & ride system in place
attributes.background:
As an asthmatic i find towns with no Park & Ride, such as Southampton, cause irritation to the lung,s.
It is irresponsible  not to provide the facilities for shopper & visitor traffic to park outside the city.
We cannot clean up air quality, if we just encourage more & more vehicle,s into Towns

attributes.action: Government must restrict FIFA officials travel to the UK pending a full apology
attributes.background: It is at the government's discretion to restrict access to the UK of those deemed to be unconducive to the public interest. FIFA decision to enter into disciplinary proceedings against both the English & Scottish teams for wearing the universal emblem of remembrance the poppy is just that.
attributes.additional_details: Civilised cultures remember those who made the ultimate sacrifice in defending freedom, the wearing of the poppy isn't restricted to remembering British fallen but those of the commonwealth and respect of those who thought against us in the hope their sacrifice wasn't in vain. The poppy isn't a political image but one of hope/respect and even reconsideration. Any travel ban on FIFA officials should stand until such time as a full and unconditional apology is made to both nations teams by FIFA.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Call to ban any form of media that incites xenophobia, racism or hate.
attributes.background: There should be no tolerance to established media holding extreme, sensationalist views that provoke racial segregation, inequality and hatred toward others.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 we should not be using or allowing history to be a light suggestion of how to move forwards in becoming a more balanced and fair society that extends its care not just to the perimeters of its own towns and countries but to the entire world. We live in a multicultural society that extends to a multicultural world and we cannot continue to allow low rate tabloids or any other form of media to provoke anger in to people that gives rise to views of racism and segregation and fuels hatred.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.
